chapter.title: Compute API v2 extensions (SUPPORTED)
chapter.para: Extensions add features, MIME types, actions, states, headers, parameters, and resources to the core Compute API without requiring a version change.

note.para: XML support in requests and responses has been deprecated for the Compute API v2.
The Compute API returns the 403 forbidden error code if you exceed your allotted quota for the operation.

section.title: Availiability zones (os-availability-zone)
section.para: Gets availability zone information.

section.title: Server admin actions (action)
section.para: Administrator only. Performs actions on a server. Specify the action in the request body.

section.title: Server diagnostics (diagnostics)
section.para: Gets the usage data for a server.

section.title: Flavor access (flavors)
section.para: Creates and gets details for private flavors. Also, lists, adds, and removes tenants' access to private flavors.

section.title: Flavors with FlavorDisabled attribute (flavors)
section.para: Get details for a flavor, and list details for available flavors. Includes the OS-FLV-DISABLED:disabled extended attribute.

section.title: Flavor extra-specs (os-extra-specs)
section.para: List, create, and update the extra-specs or keys for a flavor.

section.title: Flavors with rxtx_factor extended attribute (flavors)
section.para: Create, get details for, and list details for flavors. Includes the rxtx_factor extended attribute, related to configured bandwidth cap values.

section.title: Flavors with extended attributes (flavors)
section.para: Create, get details for, and list details for flavors. Includes the rxtx_factor, OS-FLV-EXT-DATA:ephemeral, and swap extended attributes.

section.title: Flavors create or delete (flavors)
section.para: Create or delete flavors.

section.title: Flavors swap value
section.para: Create or list flavors with a swap value. Requires the os-flavormanage extension. The swap value is the amount of swap disk space, in GBs, to allocate to a server.

section.title: Images with size attribute (images)
section.para: List details for available images or get details for a specified image. Includes the OS-EXT-IMG-SIZE:size extended attribute, which shows the image size.

section.title: Limits with project usage (limits)
section.para: Extend limits to show the project usage. Show information such as RAM or instance quotas usage.

section.title: Limits with project usage for administrators (limits)
section.para: Extend limits to enable administrators to show the project usage for a specified customer project ID. Show information such as RAM or instance quotas usage.

section.title: Guest agents (os-agents)
section.para: Create, update, and delete guest agents. Use guest agents to access files on the disk, configure networking, or run other applications or scripts in the guest while it runs. This hypervisor-specific extension is not currently enabled for KVM. Use of guest agents is possible only if the underlying service provider uses the Xen driver.

section.title: Host aggregates (os-aggregates)
section.para: Create and manage host aggregates. An aggregate assigns metadata to groups of compute nodes. Aggregates are only visible to the cloud provider.

section.title: Attach interfaces (os-interface)
section.para: Create, list, get details for, and delete port interfaces.

section.title: Root certificates (os-certificates)
section.para: Create and show details for a root certificate.

section.title: Cloudpipe (os-cloudpipe)
section.para: Manage virtual VPNs for projects.

section.title: Server console output (os-console-output)
section.para: Get console output for a server instance.

section.title: Server console (os-consoles)
section.para: Get a console for a server instance.

section.title: Server deferred delete (os-deferred-delete)
section.para: Force-delete a server or restore a deleted server.

section.title: Fixed IPs (os-fixed-ips)
section.para: Show data for a specified fixed IP, such as host name, CIDR, and address. Also, reserve or free a fixed IP.

section.title: Floating IP DNS records (os-floating-ip-dns)
section.para: Manage DNS records associated with IP addresses allocated by the floating IPs extension. Requests are dispatched to a DNS driver selected at startup.

section.title: Floating IP pools (os-floating-ip-pools)
section.para: Manage groups of floating IPs.

section.title: Floating IPs (os-floating-ips)
section.para: Assign and allocate floating IP addresses to instances that run in an OpenStack cloud.

section.title: Floating IPs bulk (os-floating-ips-bulk)
section.para: Bulk-create, delete, and list floating IPs. By default, the pool is named nova. Use the os-floating-ip-pools extension to view available pools.

section.title: Hosts (os-hosts)
section.para: Manage physical hosts.

section.title: Hypervisors (os-hypervisors)
section.para: Display extra statistical information from the machine that hosts the hypervisor through the API for the hypervisor (XenAPI or KVM/libvirt).

section.title: Server actions (os-instance-actions)
section.para: List available actions for a specified server. Administrators can get details for a specified action for a specified server.

section.title: Keypairs (os-keypairs)
section.para: Generate, import, and delete SSH keys.

section.title: Migrations (os-migrations)
section.para: Administrators only. Fetch in-progress migrations for a region or a specified cell in a region.

section.title: Networks (os-networks)
section.para: Show network information for or delete networks. Also, disassociate a network from a project if you use vlan mode.

section.title: Network extended attributes (os-extended-networks)
section.para: Create, show details for, and list networks with extended attributes.

section.title: Quota class (os-quota-class-sets)
section.para: Quota classes management support.

section.title: Quota sets (os-quota-sets)
section.para: Administrators only, depending on policy settings. View quotas for a tenant and view and update default quotas.

section.title: Rules for default security group (os-security-group-default-rules)
section.para: List, show information for, and create default security group rules.

section.title: Security groups (os-security-groups)
section.para: List, show information for, create, and delete security groups.

section.title: Server groups (os-server-groups)
section.para: List, show information for, create, and delete server groups.

section.title: Server password (os-server-password)
section.para: Get and reset the encrypted administrative password set through the metadata service.

section.title: Server shelve (servers)
section.para: Shelve running servers, restore shelved servers, and remove shelved servers.

Shelving is useful when you have an unused instance that you would like to keep for later use. For example, at the end of a work week you can shelve an instance and at the start of the next week you can unshelve it.
Your cloud provider might bill you for a shelved server.
Use the shelve action to shelve a server. All associated data and resources are kept but anything still in memory is not retained.
Use the unshelve action to restore a shelved instance.
Use the shelveOffload action to remove a shelved instance that you no longer need.

section.title: Server start and stop (servers)
section.para: Start a stopped server or stop a running server.

section.title: Manage services (os-services)
section.para: List, enable, and disable Compute services in all hosts.

section.title: Usage reports (os-simple-tenant-usage)
section.para: Report usage statistics on compute and storage resources.

section.title: Virtual interfaces (os-virtual-interfaces)
section.para: List the virtual interfaces for a specified server instance.

section.title: Volume extension (os-volumes, os-snapshots)
section.para: Manage volumes and snapshots for use with the Compute API.

section.title: Volume attachments (os-volume_attachments)
section.para: Attach volumes created through the volume API to server instances. Also, list volume attachments for a server instance, get volume details for a volume attachment, and delete a volume attachment.

section.title: Servers with block device mapping format (servers)
section.para: Create a server with a block device mapping.

section.title: Server OS-EXT-IPS-MAC:mac_addr extended attribute (servers)
section.para: Add OS-EXT-IPS-MAC:mac_addr extended attribute when you create, show information for, or list servers.

section.title: Configuration drive (servers)
section.para: Extend servers and images with a configuration drive.

section.title: Servers with extended availability zones (servers)
section.para: Show the instance availability zone for compute nodes (nova-compute). Internal services appear in their own internal availability zone.

section.title: Servers and images with disk config (servers, images)
section.para: Extend servers with the diskConfig attribute.

section.title: Server IP type (servers)
section.para: Show the type of the IP addresses assigned to an instance. Type is either fixed or floating.

section.title: Server extended attributes (servers)
section.para: Show metadata for servers.

section.title: Server extended status (servers)
section.para: Show extended status information, vm_state, task_state, and power_state, in detailed server responses.

section.title: Servers multiple create (servers)
section.para: Create one or more servers with an optional reservation ID. The request and response examples show how to create multiple servers with or without a reservation ID.

section.title: Server rescue and unrescue (servers)
section.para: Put a server into rescue mode or unrescue a server in rescue mode.

section.title: Extended server rescue (servers)
section.para: Put a server into rescue mode and optionally include rescue image reference.

section.title: Servers with scheduler hints (servers)
section.para: Create a server with scheduler hints.
